## The Effect of Vitamin C on Tooth Growth in Guinea Pigs 

The response is the length of odontoblasts (cells responsible for tooth growth) in 60 guinea pigs. Each animal received one of three dose levels of vitamin C  (0.5, 1, and 2 mg/day) by one of two delivery methods, 
(orange juice or ascorbic acid (a form of vitamin C and coded as VC).

This data contains 60 observations with the following variables

- **len** - Numeric tooth length.</li>
- **supp** - factor of drug given ( each drug to each person) </li>
- **ID** - Patient ID
